reviews.review_msg: One of the worst profs I've ever had. She is teaching basic content for a 300-level class and makes the class write reflections where the class is expected to have life-changing experiences within two weeks of each other. No set expectations and would grade hard when the criteria did not reflect what the TAs would grade. Avoid the prof not worth it

To start off, Dr. Wiley is a great person and lecturer. However, she is teaching 100 level subjects in a 300 level class and expects you to have major revelations surrounding them. The TA's were tough graders even though the assignments guidelines were vague and based on your own reflections. SAVE your gpa and don't take this class.

Took this class with her in Fall 2017. Class consisted of weekly 10 liners, in class discussion, 3 critical reflections (6-8 pgs), and a book review (10-12 pgs), group presentation. A lot of writing but no exams. Has very clear guidelines for papers, lots of instructions, tells you exactly what she wants. Sarcastic humour (not rude!). Very caring!

Contrary to popular belief, I think Dr. Perkins is a very fair professor. She is passionate about the topics in the course and encourages students to engage critically as future criminal justice practitioners. Yes, she may seem off-putting at first, but for an upper-level instructor she is thoughtful of students and tries her best to engage.

She is a good prof, but super opinionated to the point where you have to cater all of your papers to her ideas or she gets pissed. LOTS of writing, really makes you work for the grade. Not a bad class per se but get ready to work.

Best prof I've had at SFU. Lots of papers and no exams. Come to class, participate, critically analyze class topics in your papers and you can do well. This professor is always available to talk to students, although she seems intimidating at first, she is actually very approachable.

Don't take if u think u can slack off & end with an A. She'll make u work for the grade. She challenges u to be critical & analytical while being supportive. She has a good sense of humor, is passionate & knowledgeable about what she teaches. Take a class with her if u want to be challenged & enlightened. Isn't that what university is about?!

This class is not an easy A: there are 3 (5-8 pg) papers-10% each, one book review (12-15pg.)-30 % and weekly canvas posts worth 15%. The lectures were inspiring and this prof is ALWAYS available to talk with. This is a REAL uni class where there is intelligent discussion, critical analysis, prep for real world. Take if u want to work hard & learn.
Tough marker. If you don't complete all assignments even if they are worth 1% she won't pass you. Also, her feedback on papers is VERY rude. Never had a prof be as unprofessional as Perkins.

Worst experience I ever had in my 4 years University life. Her marking system is very tough, and I received the lowest grade in my university time from her. However, she did prepare class for students with lots of information and knowledge, and her office hour is always avaliable. Overall, I strongly not recommandate if you want to maintain yourGPA

I really enjoyed this course. The material is really engaging and Dr. Perkins is a great lecturer and funny! I found her to be quite fair marking wise. As long as you put in effort you will be fine! It is a very writing-intensive course when you consider the papers and online weekly reading summaries. See if you can negotiate to take one paper out.

Course seems easy on the surface but papers were graded way too harshly given the amount of freedom we have when writing about the topics even when you follow everything on the criteria and rubric. Lectures were also rather dry.

She was clear on what she wanted. However, to get an A in her class you have to go above and beyond. She was very open to constructive criticism and encouraged it. Her lectures were alright - not the most boring or most interesting. Weekly quizzes but they barely affect your grades.

Shana is lectures are nothing special and kinda dry. Get ready for read the textbook and every single chapter because she has weekly quizzes for all of them. The TA also marks the assignments extremely harshly and does not provide helpful feedback. They miscalculated everyone's midterm marks which was quite annoying and required major corrections.

Course content was interesting but could have been delivered in a more engaging, exciting way. The prof was caring and available for help outside class. Participation required in tutorials but it was easy to get a perfect participation mark. The written assignments seem easy based on the instructions  but were marked tougher than expected.
